poem:
Title: "Velocity of Thought"

On roads mapped by a mathematician's dream,
Cars are taught to swim upstream.
Not for the Autobahn or the Nascar race,
But for the heart that hums in a slower pace.
Why then like a gazelle outrun the wind,
When the limit's sign has long been pinned?
Perhaps, so we know, beyond our axes,
The exhilarating thrill of breaking stasis.
